snippet: Jeneba Tarmoh is still struggling to understand how a close race at the United States Olympic trials nearly three weeks ago left her without a spot in the 100 meters at the London Games.
abstract: Sprinter Jeneba Tarmoh remains dismayed by how the disputed finish between her and Allyson Felix in the 100 meters at the United States Olympic trials was handled; says if she had to do it over again, she may have not initially agreed to the runoff.
lead_paragraph: Jeneba Tarmoh is still struggling to understand how a close race at the United States Olympic trials nearly three weeks ago left her without a spot in the 100 meters at the London Games.

headline.seo: 2012 London Games: For 2 U.S. Runners, Dead Heat Controversy Simply Will Not Die
headline.main: Dead Heat Controversy Simply Will Not Die
headline.print_headline: Dead Heat Controversy Simply Will Not Die
